question.body: Which of the following does not describe the extrinsic pathway?

multiple_choice.choice: Activated when plasma is exposed to a negatively charged surface such as collagen.
Thrombin will convert fibrinogen to fibrin.

response.feedback: Correct. The extrinsic pathway requires damaged cells to signal a beginning. The intrinsic pathway will activate when exposed to collagen.
Incorrect. Extrinsic pathway begins with damaged cells releasing chemicals such as thromboplastin.
Incorrect. Phospholipids and calcium play an important role in both clotting pathways.
Incorrect. Thrombin is required to convert fibrinogen to fibrin.
